snippet: This sweet and savory black-eyed pea dish, from vegan cookbook author Chloe Coscarelli, calls for canned beans so it comes together in about a half hour. Serve with Ms. Coscarelli's <a href="http://cooking.nytimes.com/recipes/12949-vegan-quick-bis...

headline.main: Southern Skillet Black-Eyed Peas and Cauliflower With Quick Biscuits
headline.name: Southern Black-Eyed Peas and Cauliflower
Jacques Pépin's Steamed and Roasted Turkey

snippet: Apple’s settlement of an Android-related lawsuit could be a sign that its chief wants to end the distraction of patent fights, but it does not necessarily portend a similar agreement with Samsung.
abstract: Apple and Android smartphone maker HTC announce agreement to dismiss series of lawsuits filed against each other in feud that has mounted for over two years; settlement may be sign that Apple wants to end the distraction of numerous patent fights, but it does not necessarily portend similar agreement with chief rival Samsung.

headline.main: As Apple’s Battle With HTC Ends, Smartphone Patent Fights Continue
headline.print_headline: As Apple’s Battle With HTC Ends, Smartphone Patent Fights Continue

snippet: Suspended shopping restrictions on Sunday provided a glimpse of what residents in Paramus, N.J., fear the town would look like if current laws were scrapped for good.
abstract: Suspension of Bergen County, NJ, blue laws, which ban retail shopping on Sundays, in aftermath of Hurricane Sandy, provide a glimpse of what residents in Paramus, NJ, fear the town would look like if current laws were scrapped for good; for those who say the bans are the only way to preserve some peace and quiet around town, the statutes are seen as sacrosanct.

headline.main: Storm Brings Extra Day of Shopping to a Town
headline.print_headline: Ban on Sunday Shopping Eases for Some Residents

snippet: Biometric data-gathering — from palm scans to facial-recognition software — is all the rage. But consumer advocates worry that the public may be losing privacy.
abstract: Natasha Singer Slipstream column observes that biometric data-gathering--from palm scans to facial-recognition software--is all the rage; points out consumer advocates say enterprises are increasingly employing biometric data to improve convenience, but worry that the public may be losing privacy.

headline.main: When a Palm Reader Knows More Than Your Life Line
headline.print_headline: When a Palm Reader Knows More Than Your Life Line

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: New York University Langone Medical Center

snippet: Jeff Weiner of LinkedIn says the company follows the “next play” philosophy of Duke University basketball — that the team shouldn’t dwell on celebrating recent successes or lamenting failures.
abstract: Adam Bryant Corner Office column features interview with LinkedIn chief executive Jeff Weiner discussing his management technique.

headline.main: In Sports or Business, Always Prepare for the Next Play
headline.print_headline:
In Sports or Business, Always Be Prepared
For the Next Play

snippet: In Hurricane Sandy’s aftermath, Occupy Wall Street has tapped into an unfulfilled desire among city residents to assist in the recovery.
abstract: Occupy Sandy is a do-it-yourself disaster relief organization established by Occupy Wall Street to respond to victims of Hurricane Sandy; efforts have brought an impromptu renewal of the passions of Zuccotti Park, tapping into the desire of many New York City residents to assist in recovery.

headline.main: Occupy Sandy: A Movement Moves to Relief
headline.print_headline: The Aftermath: A Movement Moves to Relief

snippet: At Republic, a boisterous gastropub in Bloomfield, Conn., what unifies the menu’s wild eclecticism is the chef’s decision to take the path of highest calories.
abstract: Rand Richards Cooper reviews Republic restaurant in Bloomfield (Metropolitan/Connecticut).

headline.main: A Diverse Menu Unified by Calories
headline.print_headline: A Diverse Menu Unified by Calories

snippet: Two young adult novels imagine worlds affected by alarming technology.
abstract: Maureen Johnson reviews books Crewel: Crewel World: Book 1 by Gennifer Albin and Eve & Adam by Michael Grant and Katherine Applegate.

snippet: My Scotch-whisky-inflected alternative to a Jack Rose.
